summary.para: This class represents a communication partner (service).

It is the source or destination of message exchange.

summary.para: Universal resource identifier for the service or client.
E.g. RouterService: http://localhost:40000/AsyncWcfLib/RouterService
To support networks without DNS server, the WcfRouter sends a list of all IP-Adresses of a host.
May be null, as long as no info from WcfRouter has been received.

member.name: P:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.IActorPortId.TimeoutSeconds
member.summary: After a service has no message received for TimeoutSeconds, it may render the connection to this client as disconnected. 0 means no timeout. The client should send at least 2 messages each TimeoutSeconds-period in order to keep the correct connection state on the service. A Service is trying to notify 2 messages each TimeoutSeconds-period in order to check a dual-Http connection.

summary.para: Gets or sets the state of the incoming service connection from the network.
May be called from any thread.
Setting InputStateFromNetwork to WcfState.Ok or WcfState.Connecting reconnects a previously disconnected link.
These states may be set only after an initial call to TryConnect from the active services internal thread.
Setting other states will disconnect the WCF service from network.

member.summary: Send a request message to the partner on the outgoing connection. member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.ActorInput.Open
member.summary: Opens the service for incomming connections (same as TryConnect). The method is accessible only by the owner of this ActorInput object. No interface exposes the method. - Incoming connections from network: Opens a WCF service. Open picks up the synchronization context and must be called on the receiving thread only! A WcfPartnerMessage is received, when the connection is established. The connect-process runs asynchronous and does involve an address registration at the WcfRouter (when RouterClient is not disabled).

member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.ActorOutput.TryConnect
member.summary: 'TryConnect' opens the outgoing connection to the previously linked partner. The method is accessible by the owner of this ActorOutput object only. No interface exposes the method. TryConnect picks up the synchronization context and must be called on the sending thread only! The connect-process runs asynchronous and may involve an address lookup at the WcfRouter. A WcfPartnerMessage is received, after the connection has been established. A WcfErrorMessage is received, when the partner is not reachable.
member.returns: false, when the connect-process is not startable.

member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.ActorOutput.Disconnect
member.summary: Shutdown the outgoing connection. Send a disconnect message to the partner.

member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.ActorOutput.SendOut(SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfReqIdent)
member.summary: Send a request message to the partner on the outgoing connection. At least a WcfIdleMessage will asynchronously be received through 'PostInput', when the partner has processed the request. Usage: Clientside: Send a request to the connected remote service. Internal: Send a message to the connected partner running on another thread synchronization context. Serviceside: Sender.SendOut() sends a request from client-proxy to the internal service.
member.param: A the 'Sender' property references the sending partner, where the response is expected.

summary.para: Gets or sets the state of the outgoing connection.
May be called from any thread.
Setting OutputState to WcfState.Ok or WcfState.Connecting reconnects a previously disconnected link.
These states may be set only after an initial call to TryConnect from the active services internal thread.
Setting other states will disconnect the WCF client from network.

member.name: T:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.Basic.WcfBasicClientAsyncAwait
member.summary: VS2012 extension to WcfBasicClientAsync. Supporting async / await.

summary.para: Base class of WcfClientAsync to connect to a WCF service.
Requests are sent asynchronious.
Responses are asynchroniously received on the same thread as the request was sent
(only when sent from a thread with message queue (as WinForms), but not when sent from a threadpool-thread).
This class uses a auto-generated service reference 'WcfBasicClient'.
TSC is the TypeofUserContext in ClientIdent and ServiceIdent.
We accept only reference types as TSC. This allows to modify user context when receiving a message.
Specify WcfBasicClientAsync<object>, when you do not need the user context.

summary.para: Connect this Client to a service identified by the serviceName parameter.
The correct serviceHost and TCP port will be looked up at a WcfRouterService identified by parameter routerHost.

member.param:
The HostName, where the WcfRouterService is running. This may be the 'localhost'.
By default TCP port 40000 is used for WcfRouterService, but you can specify another TCP port for the router eg. "host:3333"
A unique name of the service. This service may run on any host that has been registered at the WcfRouterService.
Plugin your own client configuration instead of WcfDefault.ClientConfiguration.

summary.para: Connect this client to a service, using the ClientName for endpoint name entry in App.config file
as in:
(system.serviceModel>
(client>
(endpoint address="http://localhost:40000/AsyncWcfLib/RouterService/"
binding="basicHttpBinding" bindingConfiguration="" contract="AsyncWcfLib.ClientContract"
name="RouterClient">
(/endpoint>
(/client>
(/system.serviceModel>

member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.Basic.WcfBasicClientAsync.SendOut(SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.IWcfMessage)

summary.para: Send a message to the service. Do not wait here for the response.
The OnWcfMessageReceivedDelegate is called on the same thread,
when a response or errormessage arrives or a timeout has passed.

member.param: The message to send.

member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.Basic.WcfBasicClientAsync.SendOut(SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.IWcfMessage,SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.AsyncResponseHandler)

summary.para: Send a message to the service. Do not wait here for the response.
The response is asynchronously passed to the extension method "On", normally used as asyncResponseHandler.
If the sending thread has a message queue, the response is executed by the same thread as the send operation was.
If the response could not be handled by the On-extension methods, the default OnWcfMessageReceivedDelegate passed to TryConnect() is called.
Example:
Send (request, rsp => rsp.On<WcfIdleMessage>(idle => {do something with idle message 'idle'})
.On<WcfErrorMessage>(err => {do something with error message 'err'}));

member.param: The message to send.

summary.para: Universal resource identifier to reach the input of the service or client.
E.g. RouterService: http://localhost:40000/AsyncWcfLib/RouterService
To support networks without DNS server, the WcfRouter keeps a list of all IP-Adresses of a host.

member.name: F:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfPartnerMessage.TimeoutSeconds
member.summary: After a service has no message received for TimeoutSeconds, it may render the connection to this client as disconnected. 0 means no timeout. The client should send at least 2 messages each TimeoutSeconds-period in order to keep the correct connection state on the service. A Service is trying to notify 2 messages each TimeoutSeconds-period in order to check a dual-Http connection.

member.name: F:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfPartnerMessage.RouterHopCount
member.summary: The message from the original service has RouterHopCount=0. The same message sent from the WcfRouter on the local host has RouterHopCount=1. Each router increments the hopcount on reception of a message. A router accepts new data only if the receiving hop count is smaller than the stored.

summary.para: Adds the following features to a WCF service:
- registered with WcfRouterService (default = 'http://localhost:40000/AsyncWcfLib/RouterService').
- automatic TCP port assignement
- automatic handling of the ServiceHost
- coordinated shutdown of all ServiceAssistants

member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.Basic.WcfServiceAssistant.#ctor(SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.ActorInput,System.Int32,System.Boolean,SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.IWcfServiceConfiguration)

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the WcfServiceAssistant class.
The service is uniquely identified by the service name.

member.param: This WcfPartners input is linked to network.
The TCP port for the service or 0, when automatic port allocation may be used.
True(=default): The servicename will be published to the WcfRouter on localhost.
Plugin your own service configuration instead of WcfDefault.ServiceConfiguration.

summary.para: Shutdown this service and release all attached resources
(ServiceHost, RouterClient + WcfRouterService entry)
Send service disable message to WcfRouterService if possible
** IsMultithreaded==FALSE ** = default on ActorPort
Create and open a ServiceHost running a threadsafe IWcfBasicContractSync-singleton service.
These services must be very fast and may only access memory. No file- or database-access and no other synchronous calls are allowed.
Calls to the message handler are made from the same thread (synchronization context) that is used now to open the service.
An exception is thrown, when your opening thread has no message queue.
** IsMultithreaded==TRUE **
Create and open a ServiceHost running a IWcfBasicContractSync instance for each session in parallel.
These services may be relativly slow, when accessing files, databases or doing other synchronous calls.
Calls to the message handler are made from different threads, several clients may run in parallel
but only one thread at a time is accessing the client and user context.
When there exists no [service name="ConcreteTypeOfServiceInstance"] entry in the App.config file,
or the entry has no endpoint (apart from a possible "mex" endpoint),
the WcfServiceAssistant creates a standard service URI containig the next free TCP port and the service name.
E.g. "http://host:1234/AsyncWcfLib/ServiceName"
It registeres the service with WcfRouterService, so clients can find the dynamically generated TCP port.

summary.para: Use these static methods to write debugging trace or logs.
This way you are able to redirect your trace anywhere.
How to run it:
1. call WcfTrc.UsePlugin(x) when you don't want to use WcfTrcPluginDefault
2. call WcfTrc.Start(appInstance) to direct output to the correct file and write a trace-header
3. periodically call WcfTrc.Run() to write the filebuffer to disk
4. calling WcfTrc.Stop() during shutdown writes the trace-footer

summary.para: All data for a message sent through AsyncWcfLib.
Contains the Message itself as well as some request identification and a reference to the sending ActorPort.
The class may be used to send a response to the sender and to trace unique message identification.
Identifies the client sending the request on the remote service.
0=no remote connection or message not sent yet. Id is created by remote service on first connect.

member.name: F:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfReqIdent.RequestId
member.summary:
RequestId is incremented by WcfAsyncClient for remote connections only. Remote service returns the same number.
0=Notification, 11...=remote requests It is used to detect programming errors.

member.name: F:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfReqIdent.SendId
member.summary: SendId is incremented by WcfAsyncClient for remote connections and remote service on each send operation. It is used to detect missing messages.

member.name: F:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfReqIdent.SourceLambda

member.summary: After creation a WcfReqIdent is a request. After reception on client side a WcfReqIdent is either a notification or a response.

member.name: M:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfReqIdent.SendResponse(SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.IWcfMessage)
member.summary: Respond to a request. SendResponse may be called several times on one request. The responses are added into a WcfNotificationMessage. The individual messages are received on client side. If SendResponse is not called on a request, AsyncWcfLib automatically returns a WcfIdleMessage to the client.
member.param: The message to send as response.

member.summary: WcfReqIdent carry a reference to the user message. The Message itself may be sent to several internal partners and therefore be referenced by several WcfReqIdents. The message is not a [DataMember], it is sent separatly up to ServiceContract V3.0 and again from 3.1++

member.name: P:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfReqIdent.Sender
member.summary: WcfReqIdent carry a reference to the ActorPort that has sent the message. Service side: Sender is the client or client-stub (ActorOutput) that has sent the request. Client side : Sender is the service or service-proxy (ActorInput) that has sent the response.

member.name: P:SourceForge.AsyncWcfLib.WcfReqIdent.Input
member.summary: WcfReqIdent carry a reference to the ActorPort that is receiving the message. Service side: Input is the service (ActorInput) that is receiving a request. Client side : Input is the client (ActorOutput) that is receiving a response.
